trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux nxEnvironment Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux nxEnvironment Resource

trans-unit.source: The nxEnvironment resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to to manage system environment variables on a Linux node.
trans-unit.target: The nxEnvironment resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to to manage system environment variables on a Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Indicates the name of the environment variable for which you want to ensure a specific state.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the name of the environment variable for which you want to ensure a specific state.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: The value to assign to the environment variable.
trans-unit.target: The value to assign to the environment variable.

trans-unit.source: Ensure
trans-unit.target: Ensure

trans-unit.source: Determines whether to check if the variable exists.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether to check if the variable exists.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Present" to ensure the variable exists.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Present" to ensure the variable exists.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "Absent" to ensure the variable does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "Absent" to ensure the variable does not exist.

trans-unit.source: The default value is "Present".
trans-unit.target: The default value is "Present".

trans-unit.source: Path
trans-unit.target: Path

trans-unit.source: Defines the environment variable that is being configured.
trans-unit.target: Defines the environment variable that is being configured.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to $true if the variable is the Path variable; otherwise, set it to $false.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to $true if the variable is the Path variable; otherwise, set it to $false.

trans-unit.source: The default is $false.
trans-unit.target: The default is $false.

trans-unit.source: If the variable being configured is the Path variable, the value provided through the Value property will be appended to the existing value.
trans-unit.target: If the variable being configured is the Path variable, the value provided through the Value property will be appended to the existing value.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".

trans-unit.source: Additional Information
trans-unit.target: Additional Information

trans-unit.source: If Path is absent or set to $false, environment variables are managed in /etc/environment.
trans-unit.target: If Path is absent or set to $false, environment variables are managed in /etc/environment.

trans-unit.source: Your programs or scripts may require configuration to source the /etc/environment file to access the managed environment variables.
trans-unit.target: Your programs or scripts may require configuration to source the /etc/environment file to access the managed environment variables.

trans-unit.source: If Path is set to $true, the environment variable is managed in the file /etc/profile.d/DSCenvironment.sh.
trans-unit.target: If Path is set to $true, the environment variable is managed in the file /etc/profile.d/DSCenvironment.sh.

trans-unit.source: This file will be created if it does not exist.
trans-unit.target: This file will be created if it does not exist.

trans-unit.source: If Ensure is set to "Absent" and Path is set to $true, an existing environment variable will only be removed from /etc/profile.d/DSCenvironment.sh and not from other files.
trans-unit.target: If Ensure is set to "Absent" and Path is set to $true, an existing environment variable will only be removed from /etc/profile.d/DSCenvironment.sh and not from other files.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to use the nxEnvironment resource to ensure that TestEnvironmentVariable is present and has the value "Test-Value".
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to use the nxEnvironment resource to ensure that TestEnvironmentVariable is present and has the value "Test-Value".

trans-unit.source: If TestEnvironmentVariable is not present, it will be created.
trans-unit.target: If TestEnvironmentVariable is not present, it will be created.
